Package algorithms

Class LinkageGraphBuilder

java.lang.Object
algorithms.LinkageGraphBuilder
public class LinkageGraphBuilder extends Object
Applicable to a SparseIntDirectedWeightedGraph object, with vertex set {0, 1, 2, ..., n − 1}. Even when rankings are built from edge weights of an undirected linkageGraph, the relation "is one of the k nearest neighbors of" is not symmetric. Therefore a directed weighted linkageGraph type is needed for input storage.

Call z a friend of x it is one of the k nearest neighbors of x.

Starts by computing the linkageGraph whose edges are pairs of mutual friends. Take connected components. A linkage graph is computed on each component. This means computing in-sway for each pair of mutual friends.

Turn the pairs of mutual friends {x, z} into a stream, and count for each {x, z} the number of 2-simplices (xz, xy, yz} in which xz is the source. Here at least one of x and z must be a friend of y.

Computation of ranks is unnecessary; just compare neighbors of vertex v according to weight of outgoing edges from v.

Detects minimum in-sway t so no component of L_t has size more than a given m. Here L_t are links with in-sway at least t. Also exports edges of this graph, marked by component.

Tested via TestLinkageGraphBuilder on variety of directed graphs.

Author:
R. W. R. Darling

      higherWeightMoreSimilar - true if the higher of two weights of outgoing edges from vertex x points to vertex more similar to vertex x.

    • moreSimilarTo

      public boolean moreSimilarTo(int i, int j, int k)
      WORKS whether weights indicate similarity or dissimilarity.
      Parameters:
      i - base vertex
      j - neighbor of i
      k - neighbor of k
      Returns:
      true if j is more similar to i than k is to i

    • buildLinkageGraph

      public void buildLinkageGraph()
      First builds mutual friend pairs via a parallel stream.

      Build weighted edges set of linkage graph via a parallel stream.

      Finally create the linkage graph, by computing all the in-sways.

    • unionFindUpToClusterThreshold

      public int unionFindUpToClusterThreshold(int m)
      Parameters:
      m - maximum acceptable size of a cluster
      Returns:
      minimum value of t so that links with in-sway at least t form a graph whose largest connected component is not more than m

    • buildGraphInswayNotLessThan

      public void buildGraphInswayNotLessThan(int inSwayLowerBound)
      Usually call unionFindUpToClusterThreshold(int) method first.
      Parameters:
      inSwayLowerBound - is minimum value of in-sway for links in the linkageSubgraph.

    • buildSubCriticalGraph

      public void buildSubCriticalGraph()
      Call buildLinkageGraph() first. Restrict linkage graph to edges whose in-sway exceeds critical value, i.e. fewer links than object.

    • detectComponentsOf

      public int detectComponentsOf(org.jgrapht.opt.graph.sparse.SparseIntUndirectedWeightedGraph subGraph)
      Call buildLinkageGraph() first. Can be called more than once, for different subgraphs.
      Parameters:
      subGraph - must have same vertex set as this.linkageGraph, and is expected to be a subgraph of the latter.
      Returns:
      size of largest component.

    • getMaxComponentSizeByInsway

      public Map<Integer,Integer> getMaxComponentSizeByInsway()
      Must call unionFindUpToClusterThreshold(int) method first.
      Returns:
      map whose key is an integer value of in-sway, and whose value is the maximum component size in linkage graph including links of in-sway at least key.
